intro: Caloncoba angolensis, commonly known as the Angolan caloncoba, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in woodland and savanna habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces small, yellowish-white flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
